title: Factory Automation
problem: Manual processes lead to inconsistency, higher labour cost, and slower throughput. Quality and traceability suffer.
approach: We design and implement PLC-based automation for assembly lines, material handling, and production equipment. Integration with MES and SCADA where needed.
value: Higher productivity, consistent quality, better traceability, and reduced dependency on manual labour.

title: Process Automation
problem: Process parameters (flow, temperature, pressure, pH) are not controlled precisely, affecting yield and product quality.
approach: We implement DCS-style or PLC-based process control with sensors, actuators, and HMI. Loops tuned for stability and repeatability.
value: Stable processes, improved yield, fewer rejects, and compliance with process specs.

title: PC-Based Automation
problem: Flexible sequencing, data logging, and connectivity require more than a standard PLC. Upgrades are costly.
approach: We use industrial PCs with soft PLC / runtime (e.g. CODESYS, TwinCAT) or PC + PLC hybrid. Ethernet-based I/O and OPC UA for connectivity.
value: Flexibility, rich HMI, data logging, cloud connectivity, and easier future upgrades.

title: Industrial Vision Systems
problem: Manual inspection is slow and subjective. Defects are missed or false rejects occur.
approach: We design vision systems using industrial cameras, lighting, and image processing (rule-based or ML) for inspection, gauging, and guidance.
value: Faster, objective inspection; defect detection; and integration with automation for pass/fail handling.

title: Safety System Integration
problem: Machinery lacks proper safety interlocks, light curtains, or E‑stops. Risk of injury and non-compliance.
approach: We integrate safety PLCs, safety relays, light curtains, E‑stops, and access control. Designs align with ISO 13849 / IEC 62061.
value: Safer machines, compliance with regulations, and reduced downtime from preventable incidents.

title: Proof of Concept (POC)
problem: Uncertainty whether automation or a new technology will work in your process before full investment.
approach: We run focused POCs: minimal hardware, clear success criteria, and documented results. Quick iterations to validate feasibility.
value: De-risked investment, clear go/no-go, and a roadmap for scale-up.

title: Installation, Calibration & AMC
problem: New systems need correct installation and calibration; existing systems drift or fail without maintenance.
approach: We provide installation, commissioning, calibration of weighing and safety systems, and Annual Maintenance Contracts (AMC) across PAN-India.
value: Correct setup, sustained accuracy, fewer breakdowns, and reliable after-sales support.
